pageContext.claim: “Ten million people have been lifted off welfare in less than three years.”
pageContext.analysis: Our colleagues at FactCheck.org tried to unravel this figure, which is of dubious origin and hard to parse. "Due to overlap in participation and other factors, it’s unclear whether the figure is exactly correct," they concluded. "The bulk of the 10 million comes from a drop in food stamp recipients, a figure that has been declining since 2013, expectedly so, as the economy has improved. Other conditions may have played a role in the decline in Medicaid coverage."
